task_summary: The robot is tasked to pick up the red apple from the table using visual detection and a top grasping strategy.

task_long_description.overview: This episode shows a robotic manipulator tasked to pick a red apple from a metal table and prepare for transfer. The workspace contains a red apple, green apple, and other distractor objects on and around the table. The robot first localizes the red apple, opens its gripper, aligns above the object, computes a top grasp, and performs the grasp before confirming a successful pick. All motions avoid obstacles and are visually guided.
preconditions: Red apple present and visible on the table.
Workspace is clear for arm motion.
Gripper is empty and ready to grasp.
stepwise_plan: Check if the red apple is visible; if not, scan the area to find it.
Detect and localize the red apple precisely.
Open gripper to a suitable width for the apple.
Move end-effector above the red apple.
Approach the apple and align accurately.
Compute a top grasp pose on the red apple and store it.
Execute the top grasp at the computed pose.
Verify the red apple is held in the gripper.
success_criteria: Red apple securely grasped by the gripper.
Grasp performed with minimal disturbance to the environment.
Object in gripper confirmed after action.
failure_and_recovery: If red apple is not visible, perform up to 3 scan attempts.
If grasp is unsuccessful, reattempt from the perception phase.
Abort if object remains undetected or grasp fails after retries.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate once the red apple is confirmed held in the gripper.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the red apple is visible to the perception system.
Scans workspace in raster pattern to locate the red apple.
Performs precise detection and localization of the red apple.
Opens gripper to 6cm width, preparing for grasp.
Moves end-effector to a position 5cm above the red apple.
Approaches and aligns with the red apple with 5mm tolerance.
Computes a top grasp pose for the red apple.
Executes top grasp at the previously computed pose.
Checks if the red apple is now held in the gripper.

failure_modes: Red apple not detected within 3 scan attempts.
Grasp slip or apple not in gripper after attempt.
recovery_strategy: Retry scan if object not visible.
Restart perception and grasp sequence if pick fails.
assumptions: Object naming consistent: 'red_apple' inferred for symbolic port mapping from both instruction and visual evidence.
Only pick action shown; no transfer or place phases in this episode.
Top grasp strategy selected based on visual geometry in frames (apple on open table).

expected_success_criteria: Red apple securely held in gripper at the end of episode.
